thread.title: Matthews wins special election for S.C. Senate District 45
thread.title_full: Matthews wins special election for S.C. Senate District 45 | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: Matthews wins special election for S.C. Senate District 45
text:
By Savannah Morning News Democrat Margie Bright Matthews of Colleton County won the seat formerly held by Clementa Pinckney when she defeated Republican Al Fernandez of Jasper County in a special election Tuesday.
Matthews received 88.5 percent of the vote compared to 11.5 percent for Fernandez, according to the South Carolina elections website.
Pinckney was among nine gunned down by a white supremacist in June. Pinckney had no Republican opponent in 2004 and 2008. Four years later, he defeated a Republican candidate 66 to 34 percent.
The district includes parts of Jasper, Beaufort, Hampton, Colleton, Allendale and Charleston counties.
"Jasper is ideally situated, I think, for some really large corporations to come there with the (future Jasper port) and how close they are to Savannah (and) the interstate," Matthews said Monday.
As for the state's roadways, she has been open about her support for raising South Carolina's gas tax, which has not increased since 1987. Revenue from the per-gallon tax helps fund and maintain road projects.
Some have estimated the cost to rebuild roadways will exceed $1 billion in the wake of catastrophic flooding this month. Matthews predicted a necessary shift in the political debate.
"I hope it becomes a more realistic option," she said of a proposed gas-tax increase, adding that it would be the most immediate remedy but one among several that will be needed.
Matthews raised more than $80,000 in a crowded Democratic primary and a runoff.
